result.execSummary:
The defendant John A Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Civil judgment entered against defendant for unpaid court ordered financial obligations.  (RESTITUTION)

miscConds.notes: Defendant is ordered to pay restitution during the pendancy of probation.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Pay all court costs and supervision fees.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.
No contact with Boston Store. Engage in any assessments, therapy or counseling deemed appropriate by the agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

supervisions.notes: Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 2 years bifurcated sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

No contact with Johnson Outdoors or Boston Store.  Pay all outstanding restitution of 50% from prison account and wages, any amount unpaid upon release will become part of ES.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement.

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs and supervision fees. Collections may include income assignment.

ORD that the writ petition is denied ex parte.
FORD that Johnson's request to provide him a copy of a petition he filed in case no. 2019AP1515-W is denied.
FORD that Johnson's request to confirm that case no. 2019AP1962-W is before the supreme court is denied.

ORD that the petition to bypass the court or appeals is denied.
FORD that the clerk of this court is neither required nor authorized to serve papers on behalf of litigants; therefore, petitioner is solely responsible for serving his petitions on the Attorney General.
IT IS ORDERED that the court grants permission to proceed without payment of filing fee.
